snippet: With the Affordable Care Act poised to make addiction treatment available to millions of new patients, the groups are pursuing a formal business alliance.
abstract: Betty Ford Center and Hazelden Foundation, two biggest names in substance abuse recovery, are pursuing formal business alliance in anticipation of fact that Affordable Care Act is poised to make addiction treatment available to millions of new patients.
